Class HighscorePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • menus.HighscorePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class HighscorePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The "HighscorePanel" class which extends the "JPanel" class. This class manages all score related information by reading from and writing to an external file.
    Version:
    1.1, June 4 2014. (Completed basic implementation. Missing: printer functionality, completed javadoc.), 1.2, June 5 2014. (Completed javadoc. Need to test printer functionality.), 1.3, June 8 2014. (Added menu button.)
    Author:
    Chusa Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • HighscorePanel

        public HighscorePanel()
        The default class constructor. This constructor sets the layout manager of the panel, as well as its background colour. It then calls the appropriate methods to display the highscores to the user. This constructor is accessed through the main menu. Its primary function is to display scores.

      • HighscorePanel

        public HighscorePanel(java.lang.String newName,
              int newScore,
              java.lang.String newLevel)
        An overloaded constructor of the "HighscorePanel" class. This constructor is accessed automatically after one of two scenarios: the user gets to a gameover screen, or the user beats the game and reaches the winning screen. This constructor writes the new score to highscores file, and sorts it if necessary.
        Parameters:
        newName - String - Stores the user's name.
        newScore - int - Represents the user's score.
        newLevel - String - Stores the last difficulty the user played.

    • Method Detail

      • createLabels

        private void createLabels()
        The "createLabels" method. It initializes all indices within each array of JLabels using a for loop.
        Parameters:
        temp - String - Stores the text to be added to each index of ranks.
        x - int - For loop counter.

      • readFile

        private void readFile()
        The "readFile" method. It reads in an existing highscores file and stores the information in an array of strings within a try block. The while loop is used to continuously read through every line of the input file.
        Parameters:
        input - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding BufferedReader object.
        line - String - Stores the current line of text being read.
        index - int - Represents the current index number being accessed in fileInput.
        e - reference - Reference variable for the corresponding IOException object.
        Throws:
        If - an error occurs while trying to access the file to read from.

      • assignLabels

        private void assignLabels()
        The "assignLabels" method. It uses a loop to assign values to all indices of each JLabel array by splitting the Strings within fileInput into tokens.
        Parameters:
        token - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding StringTokenizer object.
        index - int - Represents the current index to be accessed in each array.

      • fileExists

        private boolean fileExists()
        The "fileExists" method. It attempts to read the first line of the highscore file to determine whether or not the file has been created yet in a try block.
        Returns:
        Returns true if there is an existing file, returns false if no file is found.

      • writeFile

        private void writeFile(boolean empty)
        The "writeFile" method. It creates a highscores file which stores the top 10 scores in descending order. The try block is used while attempting to write to an output file, the conditional statements determine whether a blank file should be written or if it will contain entries, and the for loop is used to output multiple lines of text.
        Parameters:
        empty - boolean - Represents whether the file will contain scores, or just the file header.
        output - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding PrintWriter object.
        temp - int - Represents the maximum value for the for loop's stop condition.
        x - int - For loop counter.
        e - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding IOException object.
        ex - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding NumberFormatException object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs during the process of reading from and writing to a file.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If an invalid integer is being used.

      • displayFile

        private void displayFile()
        The "displayFile" method. It reads in the current highscores file and displays it by setting the appropriate JLabel objects to the current JPanel. The for loop is used to set multiple labels in columns.
        Parameters:
        nameLabel - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding JLabel object.
        scoreLabel - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding JLabel object.
        levelLabel - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding JLabel object.
        titleLabel - reference - Reference variable to the corresponding JLabel object.
        y - int - For loop counter.

      • printScores

        protected void printScores()
        The "printScores" method. It prints the current highscores file, formatted into three columns. The for loop is used to repeatedly print all score entries (10).
        Parameters:
        printer - reference - Reference variable for the corresponding Printer object.
        x - int - For loop counter.

      • resetScores

        protected void resetScores()
        The "resetScores" method. It deletes all existing scoring information and overwrites the current highscores file with a blank one.
